intro: Epilobium nubigenum, commonly known as the cloud bank willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, high-altitude habitats, often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense spikes, and are usually pink to purple in color. Epilobium nubigenum is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves.
